title: Courtney Green
text: As a Master’s student in Data Science with a foundation in public policy, I explore how data can be harnessed to address complex societal challenges. My work focuses on leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to develop actionable insights that inform equitable, evidence-based policies. By bridging technical expertise with policy understanding, I aim to create innovative solutions that drive meaningful social impact.

title: Courtney Green
text:
Objective
To continue developing my expertise in data science and analytics by applying my skills in predictive modeling, data engineering, and machine learning to real-world challenges. I aim to leverage my technical knowledge and creative problem-solving abilities to drive meaningful, data-informed decisions and contribute to innovative, collaborative projects in dynamic environments.

title: Courtney Green
text:
Interests
Beyond the professional sphere, I’m most fulfilled by hobbies that blend creativity with a deep sense of exploration and discovery. Whether I’m delving into European monarchal history or crafting through embroidery and crochet, I enjoy activities that engage both my hands and my mind. I find the most joy in cooking and baking, where creativity meets intuition and curiosity. It’s a process of experimentation, adaptability, and creating something meaningful to share with others—a perfect balance of structure and spontaneity. This same fascination with shaping outcomes draws me to life simulation and narrative-driven games like The Sims, Life is Strange, and Detroit: Become Human. These games, much like cooking, require thoughtful decisions and invite you to explore how small choices can lead to vastly different results. I’m continually inspired by pursuits that challenge me to think creatively, build connections, and embrace new perspectives.

title: Experience
text:
Oct 2024 – Present
Washington, DC

Provide support for PJI’s prison education programs, offering a Georgetown education to incarcerated students at the DC Jail and Patuxent Institution.

Maintain and organize datasets related to program operations and performance; conduct data analysis to inform program development and report key performance metrics to the DC Department of Corrections (DCDC).

Assist in creating and refining database structures and processes for more effective data collection and visualization, contributing to long-term program sustainability and data-driven decision-making.

Program Support Data Analysis Database Management Performance Metrics Sustainability Planning
